values.description:
Atlas versions < 4 have 28 joints. Atlas versions >=4 have 30 joints.

This PR updates the plugins to handle both cases. It utilizes the `atlas_version` ROS param.

You will need BDI's sim interface library. Atlas v5 currently falls over.

Update:
Modified the code to only use 30 joints with atlas v5. We'll have to go back and fix this code for v4.
values.title: Update plugins to use either 28 or 30 joints

summary.raw:
Atlas versions < 4 have 28 joints. Atlas versions >=4 have 30 joints.

This PR updates the plugins to handle both cases. It utilizes the `atlas_version` ROS param.

You will need BDI's sim interface library. Atlas v5 currently falls over.

Update:
Modified the code to only use 30 joints with atlas v5. We'll have to go back and fix this code for v4.
summary.html:
Atlas versions < 4 have 28 joints. Atlas versions >=4 have 30 joints.

This PR updates the plugins to handle both cases. It utilizes the atlas_version ROS param.

You will need BDI's sim interface library. Atlas v5 currently falls over.

Update: Modified the code to only use 30 joints with atlas v5. We'll have to go back and fix this code for v4.

values.description:
When loading drc_practice_task_2 with atlas v5, the hands were facing outward with `wry` joint commands of `-3.00`. This didn't occur with atlas v4 because the wry minimum joint limit was `0.0` but has atlas v5 has a wider range of joint motion. This changes the `wry` joint commands to zero to match the v4 configuration.

![atlas_v5_task1_sandia_hands.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/bae8oa/images/2841108571-atlas_v5_task1_sandia_hands.png)
values.title: In VRCPlugin::SetSeatingConfiguration, set wry joint command to zero

summary.raw:
When loading drc_practice_task_2 with atlas v5, the hands were facing outward with `wry` joint commands of `-3.00`. This didn't occur with atlas v4 because the wry minimum joint limit was `0.0` but has atlas v5 has a wider range of joint motion. This changes the `wry` joint commands to zero to match the v4 configuration.

![atlas_v5_task1_sandia_hands.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/bae8oa/images/2841108571-atlas_v5_task1_sandia_hands.png)
summary.html: When loading drc_practice_task_2 with atlas v5, the hands were facing outward with wry joint commands of -3.00. This didn't occur with atlas v4 because the wry minimum joint limit was 0.0 but has atlas v5 has a wider range of joint motion. This changes the wry joint commands to zero to match the v4 configuration.

values.description:
Updated atlas v4 collisions to match the new v4 meshes

Changes

- pelvis

- utorso

- uleg

- clav

- ufarm and lfarm

I replaced the v4 pelvis, utorso, uleg, and clav collisions with ones from v5, and the ufarm and lfarm collisions with ones from v3. It fits kind of well, see image below

![atlas_v4_collisions.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/bae8oa/images/2289711787-atlas_v4_collisions.png)

values.description:
See issue #466.

rviz was not properly handling arrays with 0 size and the meshes were not loading properly.

I just modified the Collada files and removed the lines with `count="0"` using:


```
#!c++
for file in `ls *.dae`;do   sed -i '/count="0"/d' ./$file; done
```

For testing, just try to visualize Atlas V4 or V5 in rviz.

There are some error messages about RobotiQ hand in rviz, I'll handle those in a separate pull request.
values.title: Fix issue #466

There are some error messages about RobotiQ hand in rviz, I'll handle those in a separate pull request.

values.description: For the v4 and v5 models, the old "shy" joint names were still used so far, as opposed to the correct new "shz" names. This PR fixes this issue. Some software (for instance MIT's Drake) will throw errors otherwise.
values.title: Fix wrong joint names used in gazebo/transmission tags

values.description:
Thank you to @tkoolen for submitting this patch to fix the left arm kinematics of atlas_v4 (see #492 for more details).

Since the patch was between xacro'd versions of `atlas_v4_simple_shapes.urdf`, I first passed this file through xacro in 2b4d7f6 to get the attributes sorted the same way and whitespace aligned. I then applied his patch in d0fd0d2 and followed it up with another xacro run to clean up any whitespace. So I would look at specific commits with a large browser window and side-by-side diff comparison rather than a complete branch comparison, which has a lot of noise in it.

This is only part 1, since this should be repeated for other v4 models and then v5.
values.title: Fix atlas_v4 left arm kinematics (#492) (part 1)

summary.raw:
Thank you to @tkoolen for submitting this patch to fix the left arm kinematics of atlas_v4 (see #492 for more details).

Since the patch was between xacro'd versions of `atlas_v4_simple_shapes.urdf`, I first passed this file through xacro in 2b4d7f6 to get the attributes sorted the same way and whitespace aligned. I then applied his patch in d0fd0d2 and followed it up with another xacro run to clean up any whitespace. So I would look at specific commits with a large browser window and side-by-side diff comparison rather than a complete branch comparison, which has a lot of noise in it.

This is only part 1, since this should be repeated for other v4 models and then v5.
summary.html:
Thank you to @tkoolen for submitting this patch to fix the left arm kinematics of atlas_v4 (see #492 for more details).

Since the patch was between xacro'd versions of atlas_v4_simple_shapes.urdf, I first passed this file through xacro in 2b4d7f6 to get the attributes sorted the same way and whitespace aligned. I then applied his patch in d0fd0d2 and followed it up with another xacro run to clean up any whitespace. So I would look at specific commits with a large browser window and side-by-side diff comparison rather than a complete branch comparison, which has a lot of noise in it.

This is only part 1, since this should be repeated for other v4 models and then v5.

values.description:
Thanks again to @tkoolen for submitting this patch to fix the left arm kinematics of `atlas_v5_simple_shapes` (see #492 for more details).

Since the patch was based off of xacro'd files, I passed `atlas_v5.urdf` and `atlas_v5_simple_shapes.urdf` through xacro in a8ace49 to get the attributes sorted the same way and whitespace aligned. I then applied his patch in 2a95118 to `atlas_v5_simple_shapes.urdf`, so `atlas_v5.urdf` has not been patched.
values.title: Fix atlas_v5 left arm kinematics (#492) (part 2)

summary.raw:
Thanks again to @tkoolen for submitting this patch to fix the left arm kinematics of `atlas_v5_simple_shapes` (see #492 for more details).

Since the patch was based off of xacro'd files, I passed `atlas_v5.urdf` and `atlas_v5_simple_shapes.urdf` through xacro in a8ace49 to get the attributes sorted the same way and whitespace aligned. I then applied his patch in 2a95118 to `atlas_v5_simple_shapes.urdf`, so `atlas_v5.urdf` has not been patched.
summary.html:
Thanks again to @tkoolen for submitting this patch to fix the left arm kinematics of atlas_v5_simple_shapes (see #492 for more details).

Since the patch was based off of xacro'd files, I passed atlas_v5.urdf and atlas_v5_simple_shapes.urdf through xacro in a8ace49 to get the attributes sorted the same way and whitespace aligned. I then applied his patch in 2a95118 to atlas_v5_simple_shapes.urdf, so atlas_v5.urdf has not been patched.

values.description:
The current default branch of gazebo (will be gazebo6) is now using sdformat3 which uses c++11 in its header files. This PR should provide c++11 compatibility. We should test this against gazebo4 to ensure it works for this as well.

EDIT: re-targeted to drcsim_4.2
values.title: Fix c++11 build errors when using gazebo6

summary.raw:
The current default branch of gazebo (will be gazebo6) is now using sdformat3 which uses c++11 in its header files. This PR should provide c++11 compatibility. We should test this against gazebo4 to ensure it works for this as well.

EDIT: re-targeted to drcsim_4.2
summary.html:
The current default branch of gazebo (will be gazebo6) is now using sdformat3 which uses c++11 in its header files. This PR should provide c++11 compatibility. We should test this against gazebo4 to ensure it works for this as well.

EDIT: re-targeted to drcsim_4.2

values.description:
Sourcing `/usr/share/drcsim/setup.sh` from a `/bin/sh` shell leads to syntax errors since `$SHELL` is not defined:

~~~
/bin/sh: 9: [: =: unexpected operator
/bin/sh: 11: [: =: unexpected operator
~~~

Adding some quotes should fix it, so that sh will see `if [ "" = /bin/bash ]`, which it can handle.
values.title: Add quotes around $SHELL in case it is not defined to fix usage with /bin/sh

summary.raw:
Sourcing `/usr/share/drcsim/setup.sh` from a `/bin/sh` shell leads to syntax errors since `$SHELL` is not defined:

~~~
/bin/sh: 9: [: =: unexpected operator
/bin/sh: 11: [: =: unexpected operator
~~~

Adding some quotes should fix it, so that sh will see `if [ "" = /bin/bash ]`, which it can handle.
summary.html:
Sourcing /usr/share/drcsim/setup.sh from a /bin/sh shell leads to syntax errors since $SHELL is not defined:

/bin/sh: 9: [: =: unexpected operator
/bin/sh: 11: [: =: unexpected operator

Adding some quotes should fix it, so that sh will see if [ "" = /bin/bash ], which it can handle.

values.description:
This pull request is purely for demonstration purposes.

[Gazebo Harness plugin pr](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2346)

[Gazebo ROS pkgs pr](https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_pkgs/pull/462)

Usage:

1. `roslaunch drcsim_gazebo atlas_harnessed.launch`

2. Wait for Atlas to become unpinned and standing.

3. Raise Atlas up: `rostopic pub /atlas/harness/velocity std_msgs/Float '{data: 0.1}'`

4. Lower Atlas down: `rostopic pub /atlas/harness/velocity std_msgs/Float '{data: -0.1}'`
values.title: Added example scripts that use the Gazebo Harness plugin with Atlas v1

summary.raw:
This pull request is purely for demonstration purposes.

[Gazebo Harness plugin pr](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2346)

[Gazebo ROS pkgs pr](https://github.com/ros-simulation/gazebo_ros_pkgs/pull/462)

Usage:

1. `roslaunch drcsim_gazebo atlas_harnessed.launch`

2. Wait for Atlas to become unpinned and standing.

3. Raise Atlas up: `rostopic pub /atlas/harness/velocity std_msgs/Float '{data: 0.1}'`

4. Lower Atlas down: `rostopic pub /atlas/harness/velocity std_msgs/Float '{data: -0.1}'`
summary.html:
This pull request is purely for demonstration purposes.

Gazebo Harness plugin pr

Gazebo ROS pkgs pr

Usage:

  1. roslaunch drcsim_gazebo atlas_harnessed.launch

  2. Wait for Atlas to become unpinned and standing.

  3. Raise Atlas up: rostopic pub /atlas/harness/velocity std_msgs/Float '{data: 0.1}'

  4. Lower Atlas down: rostopic pub /atlas/harness/velocity std_msgs/Float '{data: -0.1}'
